sense.name: a regular installment payment, e.g., insurance
sense.examples: Bob pays his annual insurance premium in three payments. You have to factor in the insurance premium and taxes.

sense.name: high intrinsic value
sense.examples: This translation company places a premium on accuracy, not speed. They produce several kinds of premium beers. Fill my car with the premium.

sense.name: a reward paid as an incentive
sense.examples: John earned a premium last year for being the top salesman in his company. The army will pay a premium of $1000 to any soldier who re-enlists.

sense.name: the market price for something above its par value
sense.examples: Mary paid a premium for these organic apples from Japan. This fund is trading at a premium of 12 percent. They are paying a premium for access to water.
